skillTree.localised_description: Long-dead destriers, awakened to serve their Unliving masters far beyond death.

effects.description: Mount: Skeletal Steed

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: The pride of Nehekharan armies, impacting enemy lines with bone-shattering force and grinding the corpses beneath their heavy wheels.

effects.description: Mount: Skeleton Chariot

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

skillTree.localised_description: When the souls are released they endeavour not to return without new victims to torment for eternity.

effects.description: Mount: Casket of Souls

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: Some knowledge is so dangerous that it is revealed only to those deemed worthy of the responsibility.

effects.description:
Enemy Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: -10
	(local region)
Rite cost: -10%
Spell resistance: 15%

skillTree.localised_description: Only those who display the correct degree of diligence and reverence may learn the secrets of Unlife.

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Corrupted Priest
	(all provinces)
Canopic Jars generated: 1 per turn
Hero capacity: +1 for Corrupted Priest

skillTree.localised_description: Under Settra's iron-fisted rule, war-ravaged cities and monuments to the Nehekharan gods were restored; there was plenty and prosperity for all, and there will be again.

effects.description: Research rate: +10

Construction cost: -5% for all buildings
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: By which the very souls of the Undead can be harnessed, so their physical forms can be controlled.

effects.description:

skillTree.localised_description: Among the shifting dunes, dawn is heralded by the scrape of sand against the panoply of war, and the murmur of long-buried warriors.

effects.description: Removes Attribute "Wounds"
Wound recovery time: -1 turns

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

skillTree.localised_description: Nagash is darkness and unreasoning hatred given form, the father and creator of the foul art of necromancy and lord of all Vampires.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +6%
	(Lord's army)

Local recruitment capacity: +2
	(local province)
Passive ability: "Regeneration"

skillTree.localised_description: It was Hierophant Haptmose who first defected to Nagash and it was Haptmose who convinced the other two to follow.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +30 with all factions

Lord recruit rank: +3
	(factionwide)

skillTree.localised_description: Highly skilled and knowledgable in the secrets of the Mortuary Cult, Haptmose has long worked on their perfection.

effects.description: Rite cost: -15%
Mortuary Cult crafting cost: -15%
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10

skillTree.localised_description: There is power to be gained in the service of Nagash, that much is undeniable.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15%
Passive ability: "The Curse of Undeath"

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +15

skillTree.localised_description: So skilled is the traitorous Hierophant when awakening his legions that they move more fluently than most other undead.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +25%

Spell resistance: 25%

skillTree.localised_description: It was their own decision to serve Nagash. Not that he cares, he will make use of his servants either way.

effects.description:
Vampiric corruption: +4
	(local province)
Ability: "Dark Protection"

skillTree.localised_description: The better one serves Nagash, the more power he may bestow upon his servant. As long as they do never displease the great necromancer, their powers may never stop to grow.

effects.description: Targeting range: +15% for spells
Winds of Magic cost: -20% for all spells
Cooldown: -15% to spells

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each nearby entity death.

effects.description: Bound spell: "Wind of Death"

skillTree.localised_description: Imbued with the essence of the God of Death, the Nehekharans' blades strike with supernatural force to harvest souls for Djaf.

skillTree.localised_description: By which the dead don't stay that way for long, springing back into jerking, clanking Unlife.

effects.description: Passive ability: "The Restless Dead"

ui_effects.localised_text: Greatly replenishes hit points of combatants
